SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.jaunt
Class UserAgent

java.lang.Object
  com.jaunt.UserAgent

public class UserAgent
extends java.lang.Object

UserAgent class represents a lightweight, headless browser for XML, XHTML and XML documents. When the UserAgent loads an HTML or XML page, it represents it as a Document object. The Document object exposes the content through a tree-like document object model (DOM). The DOM consists of Nodes, such as Element objects, Text objects, and Comment objects. HTML documents, for example, begin with the <html> Element, who's child nodes are <head> and <body> Elements. Each Element contains zero or more attributes (such as <body id='main'>) and zero or more children. The children can be Text objects, Comment objects, or other Element Objects.

Since:
0.9.0
Author:
Tom Cervenka

addBasicAuthenticator

public UserAgent addBasicAuthenticator(java.lang.String realmName,
                                       java.lang.String userId,
                                       java.lang.String password)
Adds a BasicAuthenticator to the collection of BasicAuthenticators. When an authenticator is added, it must specify a realm but may or may not specify the protected directory. Every time a request is sent, the UserAgent searches for authenticators that match the (protected directory) of the request. If found, the authenticator is used to send a pre-emptive authentication header. If no pre-emptive authentication header is sent, the server will ask for one with the www-authenticate header, which the userAgent looks for in all replies from the server. if the server request is detected, ua finds the authenticator with the matching realm, update's that authenticator's protected-directory setting, and re-sends the request with the authenticator's username & password, ie with header Authentication: Basic <username:password^gt;, where <> denotes base64 encoding. The next time a request is sent to the domain, the authorization should be pre-emtive since the protected-directory is now set in the authenticator.

Returns:
a reference to this UserAgent.

addBasicAuthenticator

public UserAgent addBasicAuthenticator(java.lang.String realmName,
                                       java.lang.String protectedDir,
                                       java.lang.String userId,
                                       java.lang.String password)
Adds a BasicAuthenticator to the collection of BasicAuthenticators. When an authenticator is added, it must specify a realm but may or may not specify the protected directory. Every time a request is sent, the UserAgent searches for authenticators that match the (protected directory) of the request. If found, the authenticator is used to send a pre-emptive authentication header. If no pre-emptive authentication header is sent, the server will ask for one with the www-authenticate header, which the userAgent looks for in all replies from the server. if the server request is detected, ua finds the authenticator with the matching realm, update's that authenticator's protected-directory setting, and re-sends the request with the authenticator's username & password, ie with header Authentication: Basic <username:password^gt;, where <> denotes base64 encoding. The next time a request is sent to the domain, the authorization should be pre-emtive since the protected-directory is now set in the authenticator.

Parameters:
protectedDir - is an absolute url to the protected directory.
Returns:
a referece to this UserAgent.

removeBasicAuthenticators

public int removeBasicAuthenticators(java.lang.String realmName)
Removes any basic authenticators associated with the specified realmName.

Returns:
the number of basic authenticators that were removed.

parse

public static Element parse(java.lang.String markup)
Parses the specified markup using hints from the default (XHTML/HTML) document type definition (DTD) and does not alter relative URLs (see #parse(String,String, boolean, FilterCallback) for altering to absolute urls and other options); returns the <#root> element of the parse tree.

Returns:
the <#root> element container of the parse tree.
See Also:
parse(String, String, boolean, FilterCallback), openContent(String)

parse

public static Element parse(java.lang.String markup,
                            java.lang.String documentUrl,
                            boolean ignoreDefaultDTD,
                            FilterCallback filter)
Parses the specified markup and alters relative urls to absolute urls (using the specified documentUrl); returns the <#root> element of the parse tree,

Parameters:
documentUrl - the documents url, used to convert relative urls to absolute urls (use null or empty String for no conversion)
ignoreDefaultDTD - whether to ignore the default (XHTML/HTML) document type definition (DTD) - should be set to true when parsing non-HTML related XML.
filter - the filter to use while parsing, or null to use the default filter (which allows all content to pass through).
Returns:
the <#root> element container of the parse tree.
See Also:
openContent(String)

open

public Document open(java.io.File file)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ResponseException
Parses the HTML/XHTML/XML within the specified File, and creates UserAgent.doc to represent the Document (which is also returned by this method). A ResponseException can be thrown if the document autoredirects to a url.

Returns:
a referece to this UserAgent.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
ResponseException

open

public Document open(java.io.File file,
                     java.lang.String documentUrl)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ResponseException
Parses the HTML/XHTML/XML within the specified File, and creates UserAgent.doc to represent the Document (which is also returned by this method). A ResponseException can be thrown if the document autoredirects to a url.

Parameters:
documentUrl - the url of the content in the specified file, used to convert relative/implicit urls in the document to absolute urls; if null, relative urls are not converted.
Returns:
a referece to this UserAgent.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
ResponseException

a Document.

Parameters:
content - the HTML, XHTML, or XML content.
documentUrl - the url of the specified content, used to convert relative/implicit urls in the document to absolute urls; if null, relative urls are not converted.

visit

public Document visit(java.lang.String url)
               throws ResponseException
Directs the UserAgent to visit the specified url (ie, sends an HTTP GET request); UserAgent.doc is created to represent the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML Document (which is also returned by this method); UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse (the response headers and other response-related information).

Returns:
a Document object representing the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML content.
Throws:
ResponseException

visit

public Document visit(java.lang.String url,
                      int redirectCount)
               throws ResponseException
Directs the UserAgent to visit the specified url (ie, to send an HTTP GET request); UserAgent.doc is created to represent the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML Document (which is also returned by this method); UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse (the response headers and other response-related information).

Parameters:
redirectCount - the number of consecutive redirections occuring immediately before this request.
Returns:
a Document object representing the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML content.
Throws:
ResponseException

sendGET

public Document sendGET(java.lang.String url,
                        java.lang.String... additionalHeaders)
                 throws ResponseException
Sends an HTTP GET request for the specified url; UserAgent.doc is created to represent the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML Document (which is also returned by this method); UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse (the response headers and other response-related information).

Parameters:
additionalHeaders - each String must contain a header name followed by a colon followed by the header value (these headers are added-to or override the auto-managed headers [eg cookies, referer, etc] as well as the headers specified in UserAgent.settings.defaultRequestHeaders); can be null
Returns:
a Document object representing the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML content.
Throws:
ResponseException
See Also:
visit(String)

download

public void download(java.lang.String url,
                     java.io.File downloadFile)
              throws ResponseException
Downloads and saves the (non-binary) content at the specified url as the specified File; this method does not invoke the parser, and therefore UserAgent.doc is set to an empty Document; UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse (the response headers and other response-related information).

Throws:
ResponseException
